element.name: TChart.Title
element.short: Chart title.

element.name: TChart.AllowZoom
element.short: If true, the user can zoom chart with the mouse.
element.descr: Allows the user to zoom the chart by drawing a new zoom rectangle with the mouse while holding down the left mouse button.

element.name: TChart
element.short: Main charting component.

descr.p: The chart is composed of a list of series, a list of axes and fixed elements like legend, title and footer.
Chart methods work with four coordinate systems:

ul.li: Axis coordinates (known in some other applications as object coordinates) -- they are "raw" coordinate values obtained from the data. As the name implies, axis coordinates are interpreted in terms of specific axis -- the same coordinate value may have different meaning depending on the axis it is applied to.

Graph coordinates are converted from the axis coordinates by means of axis transformations, such as logarithmic scale. Graph coordinates are common to all objects in the chart. Consider the graph coordinates as an invisible graphing paper behind the chart; its x axis is horizontal running from left to right, and its y axis is vertical running from bottom to top even if a series is rotated.

Image coordinates (aka screen coordinates) are converted from graph coordinates based on the chart viewport. This transformation is always linear and can be influenced by chart tools such as zooming and panning.
Device coordinates are usually equal to screen coordinates, but may be adjusted to the drawing back-end to accommodate different physical resolutions (DPI values). See, for example, printer drawer.

element.name: TChart.BackColor
element.short: Color of back plane of the chart.
element.descr: Note that BackColor is different form the Color property which is used to paint the background of the entire TChart, including legend, axes and title/footer.

element.name: TChart.Depth
element.short: The length of Z axis in 3D mode, in pixels. Zero value means 2D mode.

element.name: TChart.ExpandPercentage
element.short: Default extent size is increased by this percent. May be negative.

descr.p: To ensure full visualization of the extreme points of the chart, it is usually a good idea to set the default zoom value so that the default extent is slightly greater than the extent of chart data.
This can be done by either setting the ExpandPercentage property, which increases the extent value relatively, setting the extentmanually, or setting absolute margins.

element.name: TChart.Series
element.short: The list of chart series.

descr.p: To add or remove series at run-time, use AddSeries and DeleteSeries methods.
Use SeriesCount to determine the number of series contained in the chart.

element.name: TChart.SeriesCount
element.short: Returns the number of chart series, including inactive ones.

element.name: TChart.Foot
element.short: Chart footer.

element.name: TChart.Frame
element.short: The pen to draw a frame around the chart's viewport.

descr.p: The position of the frame is coincient with the default axis position.
Set Frame.Visible to false to turn off frame drawing.

element.name: TChart.AxisList
element.short: List of graph axes.

element.name: TChart.BottomAxis
element.short: Bottom axis of the chart.
element.descr:
Retrieves the first axis from the AxisList of the chart with
Alignment set to
calBottom .

element.name: TChart.LeftAxis
element.short: Left axis of the chart.
element.descr: Retrieves the first axis from the AxisList of the chart with Alignment set to calLeft .

element.name: TChart.Legend
element.short: Chart legend.

element.name: TChart.Margins
element.short: Margins around the chart sides in default extent, in pixels.
element.descr: Note that the margins set by this property have effect only on the default extent. Use BorderSpacing property to set margins independently of zoom level.

element.name: TChart.Extent
element.short: Manual overrides for the chart extent borders.

descr.p: The Extent defines the unzoomed viewport of the chart.
Values entered here override any other automatic extent calculation.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries
element.short: The basic chart series class. Do not inherit or instantiate directly.
element.descr: TBasicChartSeries is an abstract class which provides only the minimum set of properties and methods in order to be able to be usable by TAChart.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.Draw
element.short: Draws the series using the specified drawer

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.IsEmpty
element.short: Returns true if the series contains no data.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.Active
element.short: If true, this series is visible and taken into account in extent calculation.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.Depth
element.short: The extent of the series along Z axis, in pixels. Zero for 2D series.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.ParentChart
element.short: The chart owning this series

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.ShowInLegend
element.short: If true, this series is displayed in the legend.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.Title
element.short: Series title to show in legend.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.ZPosition
element.short: Offset of the series along the Z axis, in pixels. Also determines the series drawing order.

descr.p: The series are drawn in order of decreasing ZPosition value.
So to bring series on 2D chart to front, set it's ZPosition to 0.

element.name: TChartSeriesList
element.short: The list of chart series.

element.name: TChartSeriesList.Items
element.short: Retrieve char series by index.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.AfterAdd
element.short: Called after the series was added to a chart.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.AfterDraw
element.short: Called after the series is drawn.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.BeforeDraw
element.short: Called before the series is drawn.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.GetLegendItems
element.short: Get the list of legend items for this series.
element.descr: Note that the series may return several items. For example, pie series displays a separate legend item for each pie slice.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.UpdateBounds
element.short: Update the default chart extent according to this series data.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.UpdateMargins
element.short: Update chart margins according to this series data.
element.descr: In particular, margins are used to make room for labels.

element.name: TChart.AddSeries
element.short: Adds the specified series to the chart.
element.descr: Note that the series can only belong to a single chart.

element.name: TChart.ClearSeries
element.short: Removes all series from the chart.
element.descr: Note that the series are not destroyed.

element.name: TChart.DeleteSeries
element.short: Deletes the specified series from the chart.
element.descr: Note that the series is not destroyed.

element.name: TChart.PaintOnCanvas
element.short: Draw the chart on a given canvas.

descr.p: The canvas passed to this method not necessarily is that of the screen. It can be the canvas provided by some other drawing device, such as a bitmap or the printer.
Note, however, that this method is out-dated; the recommended method of drawing is by calling the method Draw which allows painting also on devices which do not have a canvas.

element.name: TChart.SaveToImage
element.short: Returns a raster image of the given type with the screenshot of the chart.
element.descr: The image must be freed by calling code.

element.name: TChart.SaveToFile
element.short: Saves chart screenshot to a file as a raster image of the given type.

element.name: TChart.SaveToBitmapFile
element.short: Save chart screenshot to a file as a bitmap image.
element.descr: Deprecated. Use SaveToFile(TBitmap, fileName) instead.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.GetNearestPoint
element.short: Get the series point nearest to APoint as measured by ADistFunc.
element.descr: Return true if such a point exists.

element.name: TChart.GraphToImage
element.short: Converts a point from graph coordinates to image coordinates.

element.name: TChart.ImageToGraph
element.short: Converts a point from image coordinates to graph coordinates.

element.name: TChart.XGraphToImage
element.short: Converts the X coordinate of a point from graph coordinates to image coordinates.

element.name: TChart.YGraphToImage
element.short: Converts the Y coordinate of a point from graph units to image units.

element.name: TChart.XImageToGraph
element.short: Converts the X coordinate of a point from image coordinates to graph coordinates.

element.name: TChart.YImageToGraph
element.short: Converts the Y coordinate of a point from image units to graph units.

element.name: TChart.CurrentExtent
element.short: Returns the chart extent at the current zoom level.
element.descr: The extent is the visible viewport of the chart. It is given in graph coordinates. In addition to the viewport requested for zooming it also contains the inner chart margin and the space reserved for series marks.

element.name: TChart.XGraphMax
element.short: Returns the maximum x value of the chart in graph units
element.descr: Deprecated, use CurrentExtent instead.

element.name: TChart.XGraphMin
element.short: Returns the minimum x value of the chart in graph coordinates
element.descr:
Deprecated, use
CurrentExtent instead.

element.name: TChart.YGraphMax
element.short: Returns the maximum y value of the chart, in graph coordinates
element.descr: Deprecated, use CurrentExtent instead.

element.name: TChart.YGraphMin
element.short: Returns the minimum y value of the chart in graph coordinates
element.descr: Deprecated, use CurrentExtent instead.

element.name: TChart.CopyToClipboardBitmap
element.short: Copies a bitmap screenshot of the chart to the clipboard.

element.name: TChart.AllowPanning
element.short: If true, the user can drag the visible viewport of the chart with the mouse.
element.descr: Allows the user to pan the chart by dragging the visible vieport with the right mouse button.

element.name: TChart.Draw
element.short: Draws the chart usung the given drawing back-end
element.descr: This method draws the chart by means of the given drawing back-end, Drawer. Unlike PaintOnCanvas the chart can be drawn on non-canvas devices, such as a svg file.

element.name: TChart.Create
element.short: Creates the chart

element.name: TChart.Destroy
element.short: Destroys the chart

element.name: TChart.IsPointInViewPort
element.short: Returns true when the given point (in graph coordinates) is inside or at the boundaries of the chart's viewport (area spanned by the axes)

element.name: TChart.Clone
element.short: Creates a new chart and copies all properties of the current chart to it.

element.name: TChart.DisableRedrawing
element.short: Disables redrawing of the chart

descr.p: Useful when many data points are added.
Must be accompanied by EnableRedrawing, otherwise the chart will not be updated any more.

element.name: TChart.DrawLegendOn
element.short: Draws the legend on the specified canvas in the given rectangle
element.descr: Useful to paint the legend outside the chart control.

element.name: TChart.EnableRedrawing
element.short: Enables redrawing of the chart
element.descr: Must be called after redrawing of the chart has been deactivated by calling DisableRedrawing. Otherwise the chart will not be updated any more.

element.name: TChart.GetFullExtent
element.short: Returns the full extent of the chart
element.descr: The full extent is the unzoomed viewport of the chart. This is usually determined automatically as the area encompassing all the data from series and axis ranges.

element.name: TChart.Prepare
element.short: Initializes extents and transformations before the chart is drawn.
element.descr: This method normally is executed automatically. It must be called explicitly, however, when the chart's extent is needed before the chart has been painted, e.g. in the form's OnCreate event.

element.name: TChart.RemoveSeries
element.short: Removes the specified series from the chart
element.descr: Note that the series is not destroyed.

element.name: TChart.UsesBuiltinToolset
element.short: Returns true when the built-in toolset is active.
element.descr: The built-in toolset is responsible for the default zooming and panning capabilities of the chart. When a separate TChartToolset is added in order to get more control over these processed or to use other tools the built-in toolset is de-activated and this function returns false.

element.name: TChart.StyleChanged
element.descr: When any property of any chart element is changed the method StyleChanged is called. It typically requests a repaint of the chart and notifies other elements of the changes.
element.short: Part of the notification chain

element.name: TChart.IsZoomed
element.short: Returns true when the chart is zoomed.

element.name: TChart.LogicalExtent
element.short: Returns the extent of the viewport requested by the user
element.descr: The LogicalExtent does not contain the the inner margins and the space reserved for the series labels. It is given in graph coordinates.

element.name: TChart.MinDataSpace
element.short: Defines the minimum height of the LogicalExtent
element.descr: When series labels are displayed and AutoMarks is true then space is reserved for the labels and is no longer available for plotting. The MinDataSpace avoids that the series can completely disappear when very long or very high labels are displayed.

element.name: TChart.AxisVisible
element.short: Can be used to hide all axes

element.name: TChart.AutoFocus
element.short: Automatically focuses the chart when the mouse is moved over it
element.descr: This is needed by chart tools when they are supposed to be activated by a key press.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.SetActive
element.short: Setter procedure for the property Active

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.Transparency
element.short: Transparency of the series

ul.li: Transparency=255 means "completely transparent", i.e. the object is not visible at all.

descr.p: Compatibility note: The FPVectorial and TFPCanvas drawers currently do not support transparency because of limitations of the underlying libraries. Printer and WMF drawers can not support transparency in principle.

Optimization note: Transparency support in the LCL is rudimentary. The current TCanvas drawer implementation, therefore, may be slow with many transparent series and large charts. To improve efficiency, it is recommended to use as few different transparency levels as possible and to not interleave series with different transparencies. Alternatively, use BGRABitmap as back-end, since it has a faster transparency implementation.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.AxisToGraphX
element.short: Converts the x coordinate of a point from axis to graph units

descr.p: Axis coordinates (known in some other applications as object coordinates) refer to the "raw" coordinate values obtained from the data. As the name implies, axis coordinates are interpreted in terms of the specific axis -- the same coordinate value may have different meanings depending on the axis it is applied to.

Graph coordinates are converted from the axis coordinates using axis transformations, such as logarithmic scale. Graph coordinates are common to all objects in the chart. Consider the graph coordinates as an invisible graphing paper behind the chart; its x axis is horizontal running from left to right, and its y axis is vertical running from bottom to top even if a series is rotated.

Image coordinates roughly correspond to the screen pixels and are converted from graph coordinates based on the chart viewport. This transformation is always linear and can be influenced by chart tools such as zooming and panning.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.AxisToGraphY
element.short: Converts the y coordinate of a point from axis to graph units

descr.p: Axis coordinates (known in some other applications as object coordinates) refer to the "raw" coordinate values obtained from the data. As the name implies, axis coordinates are interpreted in terms of the specific axis -- the same coordinate value may have different meanings depending on the axis it is applied to.

Image coordinates roughly correspond to the screen pixels and are converted from graph coordinates based on the chart viewport. This transformation is always linear and can be influenced by chart tools such as zooming and panning.Graph coordinates are converted from the axis coordinates using axis transformations, such as logarithmic scale. Graph coordinates are common to all objects in the chart. Consider the graph coordinates as an invisible graphing paper behind the chart; its x axis is horizontal running from left to right, and its y axis is vertical running from bottom to top even if a series is rotated.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.GraphToAxisX
element.short: Converts the x coordinate of a point from graph to axis units

descr.p: Axis coordinates (known in some other applications as object coordinates) refer to the "raw" coordinate values obtained from the data. As the name implies, axis coordinates are interpreted in terms of the specific axis -- the same coordinate value may have different meanings depending on the axis it is applied to.

Graph coordinates are converted from the axis coordinates using axis transformations, such as logarithmic scale. Graph coordinates are common to all objects in the chart. Consider the graph coordinates as an invisible graphing paper behind the chart; its x axis is horizontal running from left to right, and its y axis is vertical running from bottom to top even if a series is rotated.

Image coordinates roughly correspond to the screen pixels and are converted from graph coordinates based on the chart viewport. This transformation is always linear and can be influenced by chart tools such as zooming and panning.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.GraphToAxisY
element.short: Converts the y coordinate of a point from graph to axis units

descr.p: Axis coordinates (known in some other applications as object coordinates) refer to the "raw" coordinate values obtained from the data. As the name implies, axis coordinates are interpreted in terms of the specific axis -- the same coordinate value may have different meanings depending on the axis it is applied to.

Graph coordinates are converted from the axis coordinates using axis transformations, such as logarithmic scale. Graph coordinates are common to all objects in the chart. Consider the graph coordinates as an invisible graphing paper behind the chart; its x axis is horizontal running from left to right, and its y axis is vertical running from bottom to top even if a series is rotated.

Image coordinates roughly correspond to the screen pixels and are converted from graph coordinates based on the chart viewport. This transformation is always linear and can be influenced by chart tools such as zooming and panning.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.GetGraphBounds
element.short: Returns the rectangle (in graph units) which tightly encloses all points of the series

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.GetAxisBounds
element.short: Determines the minimum and maximum value on the given axis covered by all data points of the series
element.descr: The function returns false when the specified axis is not assigned to the series, otherwise true.

element.name: TBasicChartSeries.Shadow
element.short: Defines parameters of a drop shadow for the series

element.name: TChart.Notify
element.short: Notification of the chart

descr.p: Is called by a chart element to notify the chart of something which is specified by ACommand and both parameters AParam1 and AParam2. The chart responds by sending the result in the parameter AData.
Needed for example by the axis to query the extent covered by all series using this axis (cannot be called directly because TAChartAxis does not "use" TACustomSeries.
